alert.note: Alert for Marion; Polk; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 19 at 10:41PM CDT until April 19 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Polk County in central Iowa... Northwestern Marion County in south central Iowa... Warren County in south central Iowa... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1040 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Martensdale to near Lake Ahquabi State Park to 5 miles northwest of Lucas, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Martensdale and Lake Ahquabi State Park around 1045 PM CDT. Indianola and Spring Hill around 1050 PM CDT. Norwalk and Cumming around 1055 PM CDT. Des Moines Int`l Airport around 1100 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include West Des Moines, Carlisle, Principal Park, Iowa Events Center, Drake Stadium And Knapp Center, Southridge Mall, Milo, Pleasant Hill, Ackworth, Des Moines, Ankeny, Iowa State Fairgrounds, Sandyville, Margo Frankel Woods State Park, Weh-Weh-Neh-Kee State Park, Saylorville and Pleasantville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 54 and 63, and between mile markers 87 and 89. Interstate 80 between mile markers 134 and 140. Interstate 235 between mile markers 5 and 14. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Iowa.
